title: Number of UK households in energy debt hit five-year high towards end of 2020
lead: Almost 777,000 households were in debt between July and September 2020, according to a new report

title: Scotland to have its first hydrogen-powered train running during COP26
lead: A car passenger train of ScotRail will be converted into a hydrogen-powered train by Arcola Energy and an industry consortium

title: Average warming in global cities ‘will increase by up to 4.4°C by the end of century’
lead: Average warming across global cities will increase by 1.9°C to 4.4°C, depending on the rate of emissions, according to a new study

title: GE Renewable Energy seals 1GW turbine deal for onshore wind farm complex in New Mexico
lead: Four wind farms are forecast to generate enough energy to power the equivalent of 590,000 homes

title: Poop-powered train to flush away emissions in Britain’s railway network
lead: The train, which is claimed to have ‘net negative’ emissions and does not require charging from the grid, is set to replace diesel trains

title: Siemens Gamesa lands first wind turbine order in Ethiopia
lead: The energy giant will supply 29 3.4MW turbines to state-owned electricity company Ethiopian Electric Power for a new 100MW project

title: ‘Groundbreaking’ research to test EV charging with wireless technology under road surfaces
lead: Small wireless chargers will be installed beneath the tarmac of the road and will ‘communicate’ with technology installed in EVs

title: Octopus Energy partners with Tokyo Gas to enter the Asian market
lead: The British startup will launch a joint venture with Tokyo Gas, which will buy a 9.7% stake in Octopus Energy for $200 million

title: Airbus unveils design for detachable hydrogen fuel cell wing ‘pods’ for zero-emission flights
lead: The engineers behind the design aim to scale up hydrogen fuel cell technology for passenger-size large commercial aircraft

title: From Overhead To Opportunity: How Monetising Your CHP is Good For Your Business and Good For The Grid
lead: Achieving optimum efficiency from a CHP plant starts with correctly sizing and specifying it to meet site demand.
